poem:
"Decay: A Childish Malady"

Worn hearts exhale, bending to the white sterility,
The discords shriek in child-ivory woes.
Extract the blight, burgeoning by seventeen,
A carnival of cavities in innocent souls.
Bitter the merry-go-round of health, rotting,
In the hollowed fortress of youth,
Making spectres of enamel and bone,
In the silent congregation of the unspoken epidemic.
